metadata.title: CVE-2023-0615 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
A memory leak flaw and potential divide by zero and Integer overflow wasfound in the Linux kernel V4L2 and vivid test code functionality. Thisissue occurs when a user triggers ioctls, such as VIDIOC_S_DV_TIMINGSioctl. This could allow a local user to crash the system if vivid test codeenabled.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0615` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-204-generic - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-4.15.0-204-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-4.15.0-204-lowlatency - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-204-generic - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-204-lowlatency - 4.15.0-204.215
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-139-generic - 5.4.0-139.156~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-139-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-139.156~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-139-lowlatency - 5.4.0-139.156~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-139-generic - 5.4.0-139.156~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-139-lowlatency - 5.4.0-139.156~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1135-kvm - 4.15.0-1135.140
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1150-aws - 4.15.0-1150.163
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1096-aws - 5.4.0-1096.104~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1161-azure - 4.15.0-1161.176
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1103-azure - 5.4.0-1103.109~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1145-gcp - 4.15.0-1145.161
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1100-gcp - 5.4.0-1100.109~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1044-ibm - 5.4.0-1044.49~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-oracle - 4.15.0-1114.125
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-204.215').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
